Classes¶

class bhp_entry.classes.BaseEntry¶

Bases: object

Base class for all classes that manage the entry state of additional, scheduled and unscheduled data.

check_visit_model_reason_field(visit_model_instance)¶

Confirms visit model has a reason attribute and the choices tuple uses required values correctly.

get_status(action)¶

Figures out the the current status of the user model instance, KEYED or NEW (not keyed).

is_keyed()¶

Indicates that the model instance exists (and is therefore keyed).

set_bucket_model_cls()¶

Users need to override this to set with something like ScheduledEnrtyBucket.

set_filter_fieldname(filter_field_name=None)¶

Returns the field name to be used to ‘get’ the target_model_instance or filter the user model class.

Users need to override this

For example may return ‘registered_subject’ for bucket model classes that do not have a visit model foreign key.

set_filter_model_instance(filter_model_instance=None)¶

Sets the filter model instance to be the users visit model instance.

set_target_model_base_cls()¶

Users need to override this to set to something like BaseVisitTracking.

set_target_model_cls(model_cls=None)¶

Sets the user’s model class that the entry class is tracking.

set_visit_model_fieldname(visit_model_fieldname=None)¶

Returns the field name for the foreignkey that points to the visit model.

class bhp_entry.classes.ScheduledEntry¶

Bases: bhp_entry.classes.base_scheduled_entry.BaseScheduledEntry

add_or_update_for_visit(visit_model_instance)¶

Loops thru the list of entries configured for the visit_definition of this visit_model_instance and Adds entries to or updates existing entries in the bucket.

If reason for visit (visit tracking form) is not scheduled, deletes and/or does not create NEW.

This just determines KEYED or NEW, bucket rules will reassess later.

check_visit_model_reason_field(visit_model_instance)¶

Confirms visit model has a reason attribute and the choices tuple uses required values correctly.

Called before visit model instance is set for this class.

You can override the default list of required reasons by overriding the method ‘get_visit_reason_choices’ on the visit model.

get_entries_for(appointment, entry_category)¶

Returns a list of Bucket instance for the given subject and zero instance appointment.

set_filter_fieldname(filter_field_name=None)¶

Returns the field name for the foreignkey that points to the visit model.

update_status_from_instance(action, target_model_instance, filter_model_cls, comment=None)¶

Sets up then calls update bucket using a user model instance.

update_status_from_rule(action, target_model_cls, scheduled_entry_bucket_id, visit_model_instance, filter_model_instance, filter_model_field, comment=None)¶

Sets up then calls update bucket given a bucket instance id.

Usually called from bucket controller.

class bhp_entry.classes.AdditionalEntry¶

Bases: bhp_entry.classes.base_registered_subject_entry.BaseRegisteredSubjectEntry

add_from_rule(rule_name, visit_model_instance, content_type_map)¶

Add an entry to the bucket

remove_from_rule(rule_name, target_model_cls, visit_model_instance, content_type_map)¶

Remove an entry to the bucket using criteria including the rule group.name.

To avoid rules overriding eachother, only the rule that created the bucket_instance may delete the bucket_instance.

update_for_registered_subject(registered_subject)¶

Loops thru the list of entries configured for this registered subject and updates existing entries in the bucket.

This just determines KEYED or NEW, bucket rules with reassess later.
